body_text:
I understand this is alphabetized, but I prefer to keep the isRequireds towards the top of the propTypes, so it's easier to grok when looking over a component.
Perhaps we could hoist requireds to the top, then alphabetize non/requireds separately, e.g.:
...
fetchFilteredRecipesPage: PropTypes.func.isRequired,
getCurrentURL: PropTypes.func.isRequired,
columns: PropTypes.object,
count: PropTypes.number,
...
body:
I understand this is alphabetized, but I prefer to keep the `isRequired`s towards the top of the propTypes, so it's easier to grok when looking over a component.

Perhaps we could hoist requireds to the top, then alphabetize non/requireds separately, e.g.:

```
...
fetchFilteredRecipesPage: PropTypes.func.isRequired,
getCurrentURL: PropTypes.func.isRequired,
columns: PropTypes.object,
count: PropTypes.number,
...
```
body_html:
I understand this is alphabetized, but I prefer to keep the isRequireds towards the top of the propTypes, so it's easier to grok when looking over a component.

Perhaps we could hoist requireds to the top, then alphabetize non/requireds separately, e.g.:

...

getCurrentURL: PropTypes.func.isRequired,
columns: PropTypes.object,
count: PropTypes.number,
...
